item.title: 06. Sunny
item.description: Elizabeth met Sunny in Stanford’s Mandarin program. She was 18, he was 19 years older and married. Elizabeth had struggled and gotten bullied and Sunny helped her out. Sunny was arrogant and demeaning to employees. Sunny was a sucker for #hours clocked in. 8 hours a day showed a lack of dedication. But Elizabeth had utmost confidence in him. That Sunny (COO) and Elizabeth (CEO) were dating wasn’t disclosed to the board.

item.title: Socio-Economic Equity in Tech
item.description: When it comes to STEM diversity goals, Asian American and Pacific Islander (AAPI) tends to be excluded from the URMs under discussion, e.g. . However, AAPI as a blanket term obscures the struggles of member groups, e.g. \(62\%\) of AAPI adults aged 24 and older have an associate’s degree or higher, compared to 28% of Native Hawaiians and Pacific Islanders of the same age. AA comprises \(\approx 50\) ethnic groups, while PI has \(\approx 20\).

item.title: You Probably Won't Make it to the Top [DHH]
item.description: You Probably Won't Make it to the Top. David Heinemeier Hansson (DHH). m.signalvnoise.com . Nov 22, 2018. Fallacy: If you really set your mind to it, you can do it… That’s how I did it. I just wanted it more, worked hard, and eventually all my dreams came true. I won’t say it’s easy, but it’s up to you! Odds are overwhelmingly that you will not make it to the top.

item.title: The Psychology of Money [Morgan Housel]
item.description: The Psychology of Money. Morgan Housel. www.collaborativefund.com . Jun 1, 2018. People underestimate the role played by luck. Given \(N\) investors, if \(N\) is large enough, a couple of them will luck their way into billions. But every investor seems to be doing due diligence. The successful ones will be more convinced that their methods really work. Considering the amount of investing books out there, we should be seeing a lot more Warren Buffets in the world.
